DataElement.preferredName: Patient Absence of Signs or Symptoms Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown response to whether a person who is receiving medical attention, care or treatment or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary has an absence of detectable signs or symptoms and meets the eligibility criteria for enrollment on a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Absence of Signs or Symptoms Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Absence of detectable signs or symptoms._Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Absence of Signs or Symptoms Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Absence of detectable signs or symptoms.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Absence of detectable signs or symptoms.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient does not have active
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient does not have active symptoms?

ReferenceDocuments.name: AECC Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, patient does not have active symptoms? (N/A only if patient does not have brain metastases)

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Check here if none reported (no symptoms)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance A212102
ReferenceDocuments.description: Absence of medical contraindications to a research blood draw volume of 60mL

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have refractory nausea and vomiting, malabsorption or external biliary shunt that would preclude adequate absorption of DAY101?
